rComments: He really cares about the students because he does not only talk about the content of the course, but also gives out tips that benefits the students beyond the classrooms. This class is life-changing and meaningful. I think everyone should take it to broaden their views. He is very welcoming to the students during his office hours as well.
Hated his class !

Wirls is in my opinion the best professor in the Politics department as UCSC. Poli 1 is a great class whether you are a politics major or not. Very interesting lectures, however lots of reading. A few essays throughout the quarter which are a big portion of your grade. Going to lecture made the class, he received a standing ovation on the last day.
Top notch professor; really knows the material, has experience with the reality
By far my favorite professor at UCSC. He is so approachable and has a vibrant teaching technique that makes you WANT to listen to him. Must take a class with him!

Awesome class to start off my politics major. it is also a great GE. Wirls is an engaging lecturer and really makes sure everyone understands concepts. He notices/appreciates if you speak up in class often. Midterm mc test was a breeze if you did the reading, and give the final paper your all - the topic of drone warfare was super interesting.

Wirls is great! Obviously very informed about the material he presents and makes very theoretical concepts easy to understand and extremely relevant. I felt really invigorated about politics as a result of this class!

Amazing. I am a politics major so I was into the material but if you took AP Gov in high school this class shouldn't be to hard at all for you as long as you show up. Here's the thing; you either go to class and section all the time and dont have to read, or never show up and keep up with the reading; either way you can get an A in the class.
He is an amazing professor! He's super passionate and really easy to talk to! He has by far been my favorite teacher here and I'm looking forward to taking a class with him again.

Wirls is a great professor. He is intriguing and tries to keep his lectures interesting. The class is only tough if you barely attend lectures and don't do the readings. He is a tough grader when it comes to papers but that's why you have writing labs and a TA. Take advantage of your resources and you'll do just fine.

Knows his stuff and it shows in lecture.  Have to do all readings but his classes are amazing.  Probably the best Prof at UCSC. Tests are straightforward and based on the readings.  Learn a LOT about how congress operates & that corruption is a two way st bw Washington and corporationshollywood.  Awesome class.
A challenge, but if you put your effort into the class you will be rewarded.
Tough

I think it was the content of this intro class that made it boring. I have a feeling that he could be a very interesting lecturer for a upper div class. He is very organized and has nice slides that make it so you don't really have to come to class if you do the reading. My TA made it worthwhile. Don't take for a GE.

Prof. Wirls is perhaps my favorite teacher at UCSC. He is kind, approachable, and extremely knowledgable. He can even bring humor into the classroom, which is saying something considering the subject (politics). If you show an interest, do the readings (which are extensive), you will do well. I have the upmost respect and appreciation for Dr Wirls.

Not to sounds rude but he is not a good teacher.  The way he teaches is very unclear and scattered.  He'll usually have questions each class (which is good) but when he's answering the questions is very unclear and always goes off on tangents.  He's a nice guy but he is a very unskilled teach.  But I will say he definitely knows politics

Professor Wirls is an amazing presence in the classroom and his lectures provide an entirely different perspective on material that seems mundane on the surface. This class is difficult, make sure to consult your TA on the first paper because mastering the concept of the class is difficult and crucial to making a good grade. GO TO LECTURE,

Professor Wirls is one of best professors at UCSC. He's very articulate in lectures and is extremely passionate about teaching. 120A is definitely challenging. You have to stay on top of the readings, and you have to attend lecture in order to do well.  However, the effort will be well worth it.

Wirls is a good teacher, and this class is an interesting though challenging intro. The midterms were tough, but the final was just a paper. Lectures showed effort, but often were difficult to take notes on. NOT an easy A, but also not impossible. It is much better if you actually have an interest in Politics, overall not bad.

Wirls is a great professor, definitely knows his stuff. Backs up most reading assignments during lecture with intriguing and relevant examples. However, he's a little dry in lecture. Very easy class: didn't show up to class most of the time and aced the midterms. Good introductory course to politics. Put effort into this class and you'll do well.

Wirls is awesome.  He is passionate about what he teaches and it shows in his great, very interesting lectures.  Usually I fall asleep in my classes but never in his.  Expect lots of reading, but come on, its college.  I am taking him again ASAP.

Okay, so I took  his  120 class and liked him, but DO NOT for any reason take his senior seminar.  He assigns a good eight books to read during the quarter, in addition to all the research you were supposed to be doing for your paper and your other classes and if you work forget it! Also he can't realize how his own privilege influence his beliefs.

He's amazing! The class will challenge your political ideology; he criticizes libs/cons alike (a lot). He uses rhetoric to demonstrate that people put politics before constitutionalism and that they need to not be so prone to political winds. Very interesting to analyze this material over power relations; best lecturer so far. Cares about students.

I was in the same course as the guy below me, and I remember that lecture.  Wirls' point was that violent political rhetoric enables and encourages violent political acts, and it was a very cogent point regardless of one's political leanings. Anyway, Wirls is a great lecturer, if not a little fast. I looked fwd to his course. Tons of reading though

Very informative and passionate. However very left wing, to the point of making anyone with a hint of conservative thought uncomfortable.  Spent a good ten minutes of a lecture to expound the "fact" that right wingers are dangerous, armed and ready to blow up a building.  A gross overstatement as well as completely inappropriate.
BEST TEACHER EVER... KNOWS HIW SHIT FUCKEN AWESOME TAKE HIM

Awesome professor. Loved his class, made me want to be a politics minor. He knows what he's talking about. Midterms were fairly easy as long as you read and papers weren't that demanding. Very good intro course.
Good prof., semi-difficult class; loads of reading.

Good teacher.  He is clear, comprehensive, and does a good job relating concepts to interesting topics and their usefulness.  Make's good use of time, great lectures, and overall friendly man.  I definitely recommend this class for an intro course.
He's a good professor, engaging in lecture - you can add a comment in lecture. There's loads of reading.

Basically if you fall behind in the readings you are have a hard time passing the class, also if you don't read lectures will make little to no sense at all. Th exams are too tough and have nothing to do with lectures. Basically he goes over the world today in the relation to text, so read if you take it, but i do not recommend doing so.

The classes were always interesting, well organized. Sometimes boring, usually not too bad. Takes sporadic attendance and will give you a hard time if you come in late. I thought the exams were pretty thorough, you HAVE to keep up with the reading. This class is NOT easy, but was worth the while.
boring class.

Dan was my academic advisor. I took 1 class with him and he was my advisor/testing prof for comprehensive exams. He was fair, energetic, knowledgable, engaging and challenging. He embraced your point of view and he helped you evolve it.
Horrible professor, tons of reading and impossible exams. Totally turned me off to politics.

Wirls is certainly one of the best professors at UCSC. Readings are interesting, lectures well-structured and engaging, and he is extremely helpful inside and outside of class. There is a LOT of reading to do, some of it difficult, but well worth the effort.

Wirls is hands down the best professor I've had so far at UCSC. The material is crystal clear but if you somehow didn't get it he's very approachable and takes questions during lecture. The lectures are great - he knows how to make it interesting and entertaining - TONS of reading but its not all that bad if you actually like politics.

Hard teacher but you will learn a lot. His lectures are pretty crystal clear and he is good at explaining the ideas. You will READ like no other! There is so much reading in this class! The essay is also fairly difficult and my problem when I took it was I had anemia. I still admire and respect him.
Dan Wirls is a perfectly delightful man. I would consider him to be a strong ally and effective advisor of the frustrated and obsessed politico.

very interesting class. as long as you take detailed notes during the lectures as well as do ALL of the readings you will be fine. two 5 page papers on readings, midterm, and final. all of which were very easy and straight forward. great teacher, very approachable.
I feel like I could not say enough good things about this professor. He really is one of the best. Any one who does not like him is just not ready for college level courses.

one of the most interesting intro courses ive taken.  i went to class just to hear wirls lecture. he knows what he is talking about, and he does a good job of presenting theory objectively.  fair amount of reading, two essays, a short midterm and final. no sweat.

BEST professor at UCSC! In POLI 1, he was a little distant with the students, but the upper divisions are amazing! Very stimulating lecturer- I didn't miss a single one of his classes (and I had him three times!).He makes you WANT to learn and doesn't impose his political views on his students. He teaches hard courses, but it's definitely worth it!

Wirls was a very entertaining lecturer. The subject matter is relevant and thought provoking. He's a really tough grader, so try to get a T.A. section. Also, i certainly don't apreciate being told not to show up at all if i'm going to be late. I'm an adult and i pay for my own tuition so i can show up whenever the hell i want.

No one has ever made the mistake of calling this class easy, but it is definitely worth it. What Wirls lacks in modesty he makes up for in a very deep understanding of what drives our political institution - something which he's happy to explain to those who attend lecture and do the reading.

I was looking forward to the class but found it only mediocre. Lots of reading, lectures are OK. He is really arrogant but it doesn't affect his teaching. I felt he didn't really engage with his students but rather spoke AT them. Nice enough in person, very smart, but kind of a disappointment.
This class is challenging if you don't go to lectures. The midterm is tough, but plan ahead and study. Keeps the lectures interesting.

Terrible professor, worst professor i've had at UCSC! THe guy is a total jerk, i was misplaced in the class as a freshman and was the only freshman in this course...and often sought help from him, even had him read my papers, so i assumed i was doing them correctly since he would be helping...and then he'd give crappy grades! completely arrogant!
Great class

Wirls is a GOD in the politics department!  I actually look forward to going to his lectures and although he seems a little arrogant, he is very friendly and helpful in person.  However, his tests are very hard and there is not enough time to successfully finish them.  But don't let this deter you, it is definitely worth the academic experience!

He is amazingly pompous, he has no connection to reality, especially with the current bus overcrowding. He yells at students if they're late and tells you not to show up if you're even 5 minutes late. He is rude and overly demanding. He does give entertaining lectures, but be prepared to deal with BS.
Sometimes very pompus.  Just do the reading and you will okay.  But he is interpersonal, just don't show up to his office or class unprepared.

Ahh Wirls, the Dept's fav.  We all love him and it's for a reason. He's always there for us the students, whether struggling or exelling. Doesn't tend to play favorites and doesn't put you to sleep which is always good.
He's fantastic!  One of the best teachers at UCSC.

Great guy, I got the opportunity not only to have him in lecture but also as an independent study sponsor.  He has his political opinions but doensn't let them get in the way of teaching a great class.

This dude is way overrated.  Please, he's not all that.  He told students not to show up if they're going to be late, very intimidating.  So I didn't go to class for a very long time.  By the way, Pablo is a great TA.  A lot of macho, military technical stuff, like how many warheads on a missle...
Wirls is not a bad professor, just not very good with the student/ professor relationship.

Engaging lecturer & extremely knowledgable. Class never felt like a burden, and as long as you attended, there was little room for confusion. Even the not-so-interesting topics sparked interest. Great guy, Great professor.

Wirls is an awesome professor. He is extremely knowledgeable in his field. This is one of the best classes that I have taken in my three years at UCSC. But his class is challenging. His exams and papers are pretty hard. I learned so much in this class.
Good guy. His lectures are good and he can explain things really well. The test (mid-term) can be a bit challenging and so can the papers. GO to lecture it helps so much!

Speaking as a Biology major, I think he is one of the best professors I have ever had.  Awesome lecturer and very knowledgeable.  A's are not handed out readily, but if you attend lectures (and stay awake) you can easily pass.  SUPER AWESOME GUY!

"Power and Principle" + 8am + crazy hippie liberal teacher= not a happy student. asshold grader and attendance freak but when i went to his office hours he was way chill. so i would only reccomend him outside class. PS if u have a TA pablo i feel so bad for you he sucks

His class "Power and Principle" was of the high school version of political thought. He was reaching a small 8 am audience and he also was very strict about attendance and his grading of papers was killer. Very funny, intelligent but stern man.
Dan's a great professor and extremely knowledgebale in his field. he's also in charge of the UCDC program. do it!

Politics, Power, Priniciple: The class was a bit of a disappointment, I was hoping to learn about present politics, but it was a lot of political and government structure. The class was boring to me, althought Wirls is very knowledgeable in his subject.
one of the smartest people i've ever encountered in my life. amazingly sexy, too.
Dan is a great professor and super intelligent. I thought about staying in the Politics department b/c of him but the rest of the dept. mostly sucks. P.S. He's cute :)
Professor Wirls Is an amazing politics teacher. He inspired me to take the political direction in my education and life and its because he's such a vibrant and awesome lecturer, mentor
Wirls is a pleasure.  Wonderful lectures and a genuine professor.  Honestly one of the last few great UCSC Politics professors.  If you havn't taken him.... DO IT!  NOW!

Dan Wirls is a credit to the politics department at UCSC. His classes are consistently engaging and insightful. Though he doesn't hide his personal views, he doesn't let them affect his teaching. Definitely one of the top tenured politics profs at UCSC.
It's hard to find a better lecturer in American politics, especially since he's done it all.
One of the best teachers I've had at Santa Cruz. I decided my major on account of the class I took with him, and look forward to studying with him in the future.
No Comments
Good Instructor
No Comments

superb professor, who expects a lot of out his students, but gives an amazing amount in return. Knowledgeable, available to students, and had experience on Capitol Hill. In the top three professors I've had in college.
Unbelievably excellent professor; great info, great presentation; friendly
